name: AbsenceManagement-Workers-GET-getLeavesOfAbsence
description: [Absence Management] GET /workers/{ID}/leavesOfAbsence/{subresourceID} — Retrieves the leave of absence for the specified worker.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: subresourceID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

name: AbsenceManagement-Values-GET-getStatus
description: [Absence Management] GET /values/leave/status/ — The status of the event that tracks the requested time off. Secured by: Self-Service: Leave of Absence, Worker Data: Leave of Absence Scope: Time Off and Leave

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: requestBody
schema.description: JSON request body.

name: AbsenceManagement-Balances-GET-getBalances
description: [Absence Management] GET /balances/{ID} — Retrieves the specified balance of all absence plan and leave of absence types.

schema.name: ID

name: AbsenceManagement-Values-GET-getStatus_1
description:
[Absence Management] GET /values/timeOff/status/ — The possible statuses for a worker's time off entry request event. They include:
* Approved, 0391102bd1b542538d996936c8fa2fa7
* Not Submitted, eddf5968e6d4430ca4bce9a4cfaba337
* Sent Back, 070b249867f

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

name: AbsenceManagement-Workers-GET-getEligibleAbsenceTypes
description: [Absence Management] GET /workers/{ID}/eligibleAbsenceTypes — Retrieves a collection of eligible absence types for the specified worker.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: category
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the absence type category. Valid values:
* Leave of Absence Type: 17bd6531c90c100016d74f8dfae007d0 

* Absence Table: 17bd6531c90c100016da3f5b554007d2

* Time Off: 17bd6531c90c100016d4b06f2b8a07ce

schema.name: effective
schema.description: The effective date for which eligible absence types need to be returned for the worker.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

name: AbsenceManagement-Workers-GET-getLeavesOfAbsence_1
description: [Absence Management] GET /workers/{ID}/leavesOfAbsence — Retrieves the Leaves Of Absence for a specified worker ID.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: fromDate
schema.description: The start of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

schema.name: leaveType
schema.description: The Workday ID of the type of leave of absence. You can specify multiple leaveType query parameters.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: status
schema.description: The Workday ID of the status of the leave of absence. The valid statuses are Successfully Completed, In Progress, Canceled, Rescinded, and Process Terminated. To get valid values, call the GET /values/leave/status endpoint. You can specify multiple status query parameters.

schema.name: toDate
schema.description: The end of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

name: AbsenceManagement-Balances-GET-getBalances_1
description: [Absence Management] GET /balances — Retrieves the balance of all absence plan and leave of absence type for the specified worker ID.

schema.name: category
schema.description: The Workday ID of the time off, leave type, or absence table.

schema.name: effective
schema.description: The absence balances as of the specified date using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: worker
schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker for which balances are returned. This is a required query parameter.

name: AbsenceManagement-Workers-GET-getTimeOffDetails
description: [Absence Management] GET /workers/{ID}/timeOffDetails/{subresourceID} — Retrieves details of a specified time off entry for a specified worker.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: subresourceID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

name: AbsenceManagement-Workers-GET-getTimeOffDetails_1
description: [Absence Management] GET /workers/{ID}/timeOffDetails — Retrieves a collection of time off details for a specified worker.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: fromDate
schema.description: The start of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: status
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the time off status. You can specify multiple status query parameters. This method returns the most recent instance of a time off entry based on this query parameter. 

The valid statuses are Approved, Submitted, Not Submitted, and Sent Back. This method does not return Canceled and Denied Time Off Entries. To get the Workday ID of a status, call the GET /values/timeOff/status endpoint. You can specify multiple status query parameters.

Example:
An approved Time Off Entry for Vacation 8 hours was corrected to Vacation 4 hours and is not in submitted status. If the query parameter is status = approved, the Time Off Entry of Vacation, 8 hours, Approved is returned. If query parameter status = submitted, the Time Off Entry of Vacation, 4 hours, Submitted is returned. If no query parameter is passed, the Time Off Entry of Vacation, 4 hours, Submitted is returned.

schema.name: timeOffType
schema.description: The Workday ID of the Time Off Type. You can specify multiple timeOffType query parameters.

schema.name: toDate
schema.description: The end of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

name: AbsenceManagement-Workers-GET-getValidTimeOffDates
description: [Absence Management] GET /workers/{ID}/validTimeOffDates — Retrieves the valid time off dates for the specified worker ID for the given dates.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: date
schema.description: The dates being requested for which to validate. It should be in the yyyy-mm-dd format.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: position
schema.description: The Workday ID of the position.

schema.name: timeOff
schema.description: The Workday ID of the time off.

name: AbsenceManagement-Workers-GET-getWorkers_1
description: [Absence Management] GET /workers — Retrieves a collection of workers and current staffing information.

schema.name: includeTerminatedWorkers
schema.description: Include terminated workers in the output

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: search
schema.description: Searches workers by name or worker ID. The search is case-insensitive. You can include space-delimited search strings for an OR search.
